topic.title: Difference Millchan Merger and Millchan
topic.body:
So basically I found Millchan (http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ADQAHsqsie5PBeQhQgjcKmUu3qdPFg6aA/) and Millchan Merger (http://127.0.0.1:43110/17gCoQDCAAoQkzKRiajFNUAhnVD2gSNmuC/).

Apparantly I need to find the boards for Millchan Merger myself but Millchan has them all already.

Another difference I found is that the boards aren't the same, the content that gets posted on them is different. Also, Millchan seems waaaay slower than Millchan Merger.

Which is the right one I should be using?

topic.title: What kind of alcoholic beverage do you like?
topic.body: Personally I really like whiskey (of course I started with Jack Daniels but recently I bought Monkey Shoulders, which is really good and not so expensive imo), beer and vodka (though I mostly only shot or mix it with orange juice for example).

1557421253_191qyhaRxXEx1bdtG65iQvFddtXBj.body:
> [anonymouslogin](#comment_298_17AMQVbBa12XB3xFWKDnP2dCEx92TaiY7X): I'm curious about Qubes. What do people think about that OS?

really good regarding privacy but if you want to use resource-heavy things (e.g. gaming or stuff like that) you can basically forget about it

> [insurgo](#comment_8_18UFtLHDzWDN1um1NphCGuTW4QnTsBaNH2): Or dedicate a compatible graphic card (forget about nvidia) to a game qube and game on.https://www.qubes-os.org/faq/#can-i-run-applications-like-games-which-require-3d-support

true but that means that you would need to get a second graphics card

1558266064_1DUHekDkg6jJxQKGvAY2Hni5yNdTQ.body:
It's kinda like Tor and shit

It scares people off..
"Oh no Tor is that thing where you guys buy drugs and rape children!!"
Yeah... humans are ignorant and stupid

I think the worst argument I've ever heard is "why would I use Tor / ZeroNet if I don't have anything to hide"

This is exactly why we have such a bad image just because we actually have a brain and don't behave like these NPCs

> [necrophcodr](#comment_1_1Mcuc9PBJGnBgYr2SMeLePxipeuETyzkLg): Using this does not make you any smarter than anyone else. People are not NPCs, and viewing them as such sure isn't helping furthering anyones cause here.

My point still stands though
I know plenty of people with such an attitude and the way the media portrays Tor or any other "Darknet" is ridiculous and stupid.

Why would anybody use Tor / ZeroNet / i2p if the clearnet "just werks"? It's the same discussion with Linux vs Windows..
"Why would I want to install / learn Linux if Windows just werks and has all my games on it?" "They are selling my data to [insert advertisement company here]? Well I don't care, I have nothing to hide and I can just install an adblocker."

And I know that the comparison between the ZeroNet discussion and the OS discussion doesn't really fit that well but I hope you understand what I'm saying. It's not that I don't want to bring people to use this network and stuff like that but I'm getting sick of the arguments they sometimes give

1558168145_17TtMnYrVFMh1z7Bvn8QYPUyJ4zL9.body:
You can do that or you can use another ID service

Though not every zite allows other providers, ZeroTalk appearantly also supports kxoid.bit

1558286606_1DUHekDkg6jJxQKGvAY2Hni5yNdTQ.body:
Two possibilities:
1. Make a backup of data/users.json and delete it. That way you can create a new ID but won't be able to use both at the same time (unless it's possible to manually add the lines back in)
2. Create the new ID on a different "ID zite", like kxoid.bit. That way you can use both at the same time.

1558362080_19BG5iU2A8Yyy5CVN2TMvVZPy9c5N.body:
duckduck and startpage are both pretty good

I think startpage uses google results, if you are more familiar with them..

1558550634_1BmC9X4qMXSfY449gWipdty6tYvwi.body: I guess you could set Tor as the default browser

1565354906_1GFU4qAMTFnQJ7W7r98Zj2xJWq1ev.body:
> [anshorei](#comment_13_1CgdRv2BFaVqNfmK3qGVYDuA7EDmk8dJVS): If you make a board, it's probably best to make a Millchan Engine board. [...]

> Using Tor is probably your best option. I'm not using Tor Always mode, but I tend to stick to ZeroTalk, ZeroMe and people's blogs and I'm not too worried about doxxing. If you're hosting a zite that could make you a target for internet vigilantes it's probably best to enforce Tor and maybe disallow 3rd party scripts (or use TBB, though you'll have the white image bug on some zites like ZeroMe).

Does using Tor Always also make using a normal browser with Zeronet anonymous or does it only work with the TBB?

> [anshorei](#comment_17_1CgdRv2BFaVqNfmK3qGVYDuA7EDmk8dJVS): Tor Always anonymizes all connections made by ZeroNet, there's a couple of deanonymization techniques that could still be used: [...]

Thanks! So basically TBB has some methods of preventing the 2nd and 3rd point (the first can't be fixed I assume as Zeronet needs JS).

Too bad though, TBB always had issues with unifont characters which some zites often use :/

1565373491_1PA19ZVGt9k6GEX2mYAF6w5zJCPYK.body:
The programmers of that kind depend on either donations or on one-time-jobs they get from their own contacts.
Or they just have a normal job.

> [xlk](#comment_9_1PA19ZVGt9k6GEX2mYAF6w5zJCPYKWaJEp): Actually, I'm just curious how much it would cost to hire programmers to make an app like Fopnu or Zeronet for me.

I'm not as experienced as they are but this whole Zeronet thing looks like really much work.

You could for example go to Zeronet's Github and look how long it took to get to a stable version and divide that into hours and give _at least_ minimum wage per hour.

This would be a really really rough calculation and you'd have to consider the breaks Zeronet had in the commit history, etc.

But in the end I have to agree with 
> [xcape2net](#comment_222_1GJc2vm4vJjAKsFoFJ2D3gGmKiRac2kfnz): Software engineers working for big companies generally earn somewhere between about $70,000 US and $150,000 US.  There are some earning less and some earning more.
it depends on what area of software development (frontend, backend, blabla)

1565490001_18HYVwCAgri1SgiYZcEZMehKoXZo6.body:
UPDATE:
Found this topic http://127.0.0.1:43110/1TaLkFrMwvbNsooF4ioKAY9EuxTBTjipT/?Topic:1548974921_18S47ArorYtHtcicjdGi6VZdhgJgwhrud7/Millchan+merger+site

Apparantly the dev decided to keep both for now and Millchan is the "original" version with Millchan Merger using the new merging concept.

Well that may be true but I don't care enough to not buy alcohol. I DON'T drink every second day until I puke my brains out, it's just something I do a couple of times a month when I meet with friends. Or in the case of whiskey I sometimes drink a small amount in the evening to relax.

On the other hand I smoke too so yeah whatever

lol at least red wine. White wine tastes so disgusting to me..

1566375802_1C7X6AtuFz4ARoxZAj1XaEjPprGoz.body:
Well first of all more corporations need to accept cryptos..

Would also be nice if we had one really good developed crypto (e.g. not these huge transaction fees like on bitcoin, more privacy based like monero, etc.) that *everybody* agrees on to use.

> [bigbadbob](#comment_391_1CLhLYdMKjXtium9yjuRkSnFvPfdoUTXAj): I would love to see some big corporations implode as well :)

True but I was rather thinking about corporations that you buy things from
e.g. Valve, Apple or even where you buy your groceries from

Otherwise we simply can't use the cryptos without converting them back to fiat
